condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: As the economic fallout of the COVID crisis continues,social and economic policy (SEP) researchteam has undertaken studies on children’s experiences of COVID and the effects of economic contraction on child well-being in West and Central Africa. Climate along with COVID and conflict continues to be a serious threat to children’s rights and futures and a key issue for evidence-based advocacy in 2021. The analysis for the 17th Report Card was completed and will be published in May 2022.; SEP work has adapted to a new area of focus in social protection programming and poverty measurement.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/03/2022
